title: Low Pay Commission (LPC) Research March 2011 - April 2012

collection_groups.title: Low Pay Commission Research Documents: March 2012 Report

details.body:
The findings and any views expressed are those of the authors, and are not necessarily endorsed by the LPC.

Those reports available electronically are listed below. Details of all research we have commissioned can be found in an appendix to each of our reports.

Although we cannot guarantee that you will be invited, if you would like to be included on our consultation list and/or would like to express an interest in being invited to tender for future research you can email us at lpc@lowpay.gov.uk

description: The LPC commissions research projects to inform its work.

documents.description: An examination of the impact of economic recovery on pay settlements both across the whole economy and low-paying sectors.
documents.title: Impact of economic recovery on pay settlements. Incomes Data Services

documents.description: An assessment of the impact of the introduction of the National Minimum Wage Rate for Apprentices (the 'Apprentice Rate').
documents.title: National Minimum Wage: the introduction of the Apprentice Rate. Ipsos Mori

documents.description: An study of National Minimum Wage (NMW) increases before, during and after the recession.
documents.title: National Minimum Wage: impact on earnings, employment and hours in the recession. Bryan, Salvatori, Taylor

documents.description: A description of how the recession and the National Minimum Wage affected pay settlements in the UK between 1977 and 2011.
documents.title: The impact of recession on pay settlements and earnings by industry, 1977 to 2011. Dolton, Makepeace, Tremayne

documents.description: This study explores why some employers deliberately do not pay the National Minimum Wage (NMW).
documents.title: Non-compliance with the National Minimum Wage. Ipsos Mori

documents.description: Research by the University of Sheffield into the relationship between productivity, earnings and age in the early years of a working life.
documents.title: Productivity, earnings and age in the early years of a working life. Dickerson, McIntosh

documents.description: Assesses recent trends in economic and labour market performance and the impact of the national minimum wage on pay and employment. Focuses â€¦
documents.title: Low Pay Commission: government evidence (January 2011). Department for Business, Innovation and Skills

documents.description: A review of evidence to check the accuracy of research on how the National Minimum Wage has affected low paid workers in different size firms.
documents.title: National Minimum Wage: re-examining its impact on earnings, employment and hours. Dickens, Riley, Wilkinson

documents.description: An exploration of the possible reasons behind the trend in earnings growth.
documents.title: The trend in earnings growth for young workers. Incomes Data Services
